thread.title: The history of the Tube in pictures
thread.title_full: The history of the Tube in pictures

author: Telegraph Staff
title: The history of the Tube in pictures
text: MORE... 24 May 1862: Chancellor of the Exchequer, William Ewart Gladstone, and directors and engineers of the Metropolitan Railway Company, embark on an inspection tour of the world's first underground line. Built between Paddington and the City of London, it opened in January of the following year. Gladstone is seen in the front row, near right. Picture: Hulton Archive/Getty Images
